prompts: For each sentence contained within the input data, evaluate and accurately classify it into one or more of the following categories, ensuring a complete and precise multi-label classification that covers all relevant aspects: - PINC (Pins and Cookies): Any mention or implication of cookies, tracking methods, or other data collection activities. - USE (Usage Restrictions): Statements defining constraints or conditions on how users can interact with the service. - CR (Content Removal): Provisions granting authority to the provider to modify or remove content created by users. - TER (Termination): Terms allowing the provider to end user accounts or access to the services, potentially without prior notification. - LTD (Liability Limitation): Clauses aiming to limit the provider's responsibility for damages or losses encountered by users. - A (Arbitration): Mandates for resolving disputes through arbitration instead of court litigation. - LAW (Applicable Law): Stipulated legal codes or laws that govern the terms of the agreement. - J (Jurisdiction): Specific legal venues or jurisdictions set for dispute resolution. - CH (Changes): Provisions that allow modifications to terms or policies with or without informing users. Carefully analyze the content and implications within each sentence to determine the comprehensive set of categories it belongs to, applying all applicable categories rigorously to capture all pertinent dimensions.

Analyze each sentence in the input data and classify it into one or more relevant categories based on their content and implications, ensuring precision in multi-label classification: - PINC (Pins and Cookies): Mentions of cookies or tracking. - USE (Usage Restrictions): Usage constraints. - CR (Content Removal): Content modification or deletion. - TER (Termination): Account or service termination. - LTD (Liability Limitation): Liability limitations. - A (Arbitration): Arbitration agreements. - LAW (Applicable Law): Governing laws. - J (Jurisdiction): Legal jurisdictions. - CH (Changes): Policy or term changes.

Perform a comprehensive classification of each input sentence into appropriate categories, ensuring all applicable labels are captured: - PINC (Pins and Cookies): Data tracking mentions. - USE (Usage Restrictions): Interaction constraints. - CR (Content Removal): Authority over user content. - TER (Termination): Account termination rights. - LTD (Liability Limitation): Limiting liability. - A (Arbitration): Dispute resolution. - LAW (Applicable Law): Applicable legal standards. - J (Jurisdiction): Dispute jurisdiction. - CH (Changes): Policy updates.
